# Stop the Chain! CosmWasm Stack Overflow

![Felix Wilhelm](https://jumpcrypto-com.ghost.io/content/images/2023/02/image
--202-.jpg)

###### Felix Wilhelm

[Security](/writing/security/)

Jun 01 2023 _ 1 min read

![Stop the Chain! CosmWasm Stack Overflow](https://jumpcrypto-
com.ghost.io/content/images/2023/06/blog_cosmwasm_security.png)

This post announces a vulnerability we discovered in
[CosmWasm](https://github.com/CosmWasm/cosmwasm?ref=jumpcrypto.com), a smart
contract platform written for the Cosmos ecosystem. The vulnerability was a
stack overflow, which would have allowed users who can upload new smart
contracts on Cosmos-based blockchains to halt those chains fully.

_Jump Crypto aims to boost security assurance across the crypto ecosystem
through ongoing research and coordinated disclosure to identify and patch
vulnerabilities across various projects. This announcement is yet another
example of how we continue these efforts._

**You can find more details about this vulnerability in our[markdown
advisory](https://github.com/JumpCrypto/security-
research/blob/master/advisories/2023-003-cosmwasm.md?ref=jumpcrypto.com) or
the [CosmWasm
Advisory](https://github.com/CosmWasm/advisories/blob/main/CWAs/CWA-2023-002.md?ref=jumpcrypto.com).**

We would like to thank the CosmWasm contributors and the downstream-affected
Cosmos L1s for their professional handling of this issue and quick adoption of
the patch. Thanks to their partnership, this bug was addressed without any
user impact.

Share

![](/static/subscribe2-825809a798c6960f978785c6581f4afb.svg)
